title: Time for ecofriendly and sustainable agriculture

tasks.task: Understanding the relevance of organic farming
subtasks: Recognize the current issues with large-scale agricultural practices (e.g., energy consumption, toxic residues)
Analyze the sustainability of current agricultural systems (e.g., high energy inputs, low efficiency)
Examine the impact of toxic chemicals and pesticides on the environment and human health
Discuss the emergence of antibiotic resistance in organic versus conventional farming
Explore the importance of polyculture and diverse seed/breed varieties in organic farming
Critique the concept of hybrid versus native species in livestock and plant breeding
Evaluate the effects of animal farming on sustainability and nutritional value
Consider the role of subsidies in promoting chemical farming over organic practices
Assess the hidden costs associated with cheap food and the resulting health issues
Investigate dry land farming techniques and their potential for organic cultivation
Examine the dependence on finite resources like phosphorus in fertilizers
Explore innovative agricultural practices like perennial crops and ecosystems
Compare the nutritional value and health impacts of organic vs. conventional food

tasks.task: Addressing the argument that organic food is expensive
subtasks: Acknowledge the higher price point of organic food as a barrier to affordability
Counter-argue that organic food's benefits (health, environmental, sustainable) outweigh the cost
Calculate the long-term savings related to reduced medical expenses from preventive nutrition
Highlight the ecological and social benefits of investing in organic agriculture

tasks.task: Discussing the challenges of organic farming in India
subtasks: Identify the current barriers to widespread adoption of organic farming in India
Evaluate the existing community knowledge and traditional practices in organic farming
Analyze the existing subsidies and policies supporting conventional agriculture
Propose strategies for encouraging the transition to organic farming in India

tasks.task: Evaluating the health benefits of organic food
subtasks: Compare the nutrient profiles of organic vs. conventional foods (e.g., phytochemicals, antioxidants)
Assess the potential health risks associated with pesticide and antibiotic residues
Examine the role of diet in chronic diseases such as diabetes and heart disease
Evaluate the subjective experience of enjoying natural, diverse foods
